Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Got it. [taking a group photo outside]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay let's go in. I'm freezing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People, wait, wait, wait. Come back, come back. One fun one. We're gonna do a fun one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: One Charlie's Angels. One. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, this is just a Christmas card from your paper supplier. No one's putting this on their fridge.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I got it, you guys, how 'bout this. Michael, what if all the boys are on one side, all the girls are on the other. The boys are like, 'why I oughta', and the girls are like, 'let's go shopping!'.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's just jump in the air!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it! That's a picture! Yes! Jump in the air. We're gonna jump in the air. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: One, two, three. [everyone jumps at different times] Not everyone jumped.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody jump in the air this time, please. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: One, two, three. [everyone jumps] Still some people not jumping.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You gotta be kidding me. Who isn't jumping?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll tell you who. Darryl, Phyllis, Stanley, Angela, and Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I am jumping.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm jumping.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me see you jump. [Phyllis barely jumps] Oh, my God. This is a store bought-camera. This isn't one of those special military-grade cameras that would be able to capture that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm freezing.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Um, also, Erin is jumping way too early. She's on the ground by 'three'.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I didn't want to miss it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, if we all jump really high, we'll be in the air longer. Do that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Here's a question nobody's asking:

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm the office administrator now, which means I'm basically being paid to be head of the party planning committee. The first thing I did as head... I shut it down. At its best it was a toxic political club used to make others feel miserable and left out. At its best it planned parties.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It hardly looks fake. It's so lush.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why's it smell real? [Pam shows him a hidden car-freshener] Ah... good one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, ho, ho, ho! Oh, ho, ho, ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas, little children! [dressed as Santa]

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How's everybody doing today?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How's the party coming along?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are we over budget?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No? Good. Did anyone get drunk already?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Not yet!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good for you. Angela, lay it on me. What's the problem?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nothing. Should be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So Stanley, how big is the bug up your butt today?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [cheerily] Pam got those sugar-free cookies I like. I'm doing fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Well, I will be in my office making toys for the good children. Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yea?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatcha got?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All good, Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's a relief. Santa's gonna take some much-needed free time. Alright. Good!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My kids are growin up. As a boss, I look at that and say great. It is exactly what a boss would hope would happen because that's what I want. That's what every boss wants is a, is a wonderful Christmas with no drama.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's present time, you guys. [all react] Happy Holidays from your friends at Sabre.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: We just want to say how grateful we are.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sabre is actively looking for ways to involve me as minority executive trainee. So I suggested choosing the annual Christmas gift to the employees. And they said, "Oh, yes. Perfect. Thank you, Kelly. Finally, something for you to do."

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's a Hello Kitty laptop sleeve.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello Kitty's for girls.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nashua got mp3 players.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't even have a laptop.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I wonder if these presents would be under as much scrutiny if I were white.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh come on.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I said, "I wonder." I didn't say, "I think."

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Kelly, I thought we agreed on fleece blankets.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Blankets, what am I, five?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Erin and I make great use of ours.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yes, Erin and I are still dating. Why do you ask me so often if we're still dating?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll take one of those pink pouches.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I feel good today. My little girl Jada? It's my turn to have her for Christmas this year. Two years ago I had her, and we had the best time. I tivoed her favorite shows, some things I've never heard of. iCarly... You know who's funny on that show? The friend with the video camera. He's got a nice way of talking.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, it's snowing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mocking] Oh, my God! It's the first snowfall of Christmas. Is that just so magical for you, little girl? Can you not wait to have a hot chocolate, and cuddle up with Papa and tell him about all your Christmas dreams, hmm? It's not even a real snow. Look, it's a dusting. Pitiful.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim goes outside, makes a snowball, and brings it back inside] Hey, Dwight. [Jim throws the snowball at Dwight and everyone laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it, Jim, you cannot throw snowballs in here!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it's not a snowball, 'cause it's only a dusting. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at that. There's a pebble in there. You coulda killed me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, don't be such a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah, who's a little girl now? [everyone laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You apologize to me right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You've got something on your nose.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You apologize right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very well, then I challenge you to a snowball fight on the first real snow of winter.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That sounds awesome. Can we all do it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Andy, it's a snowball fight. It's not fun. Go get your own thing. Beat it. [Jim continues to shake Dwight's hand] Jim, let go. Let go.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Angela, are you bringing you new boyfriend to the party.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wouldn't subject Robert to that. He's a very busy senator.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: State senator.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would not expect you to know what it's like to date someone in the public arena.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Who are you dating in the public arena?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The senator.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, right. The state senator.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We went to a picnic thrown by the Comptroller's wife.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, that would be impressive... if anyone knew what a comptroller was.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you have any idea how many photographers there are at a ribbon-cutting ceremony. I do. Two. "Angela..." [imitates camera shooting] "over here, Angela..." [imitates camera shooting] "here. Look here!"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Before we kick off the party, I just want to remind everyone that an office party is just that...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A party. It's not an excuse to get really drunk or confront someone or have a cathartic experience of any kind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam? Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, there are, there are questions to that. Okay. Um, you know what, no questions. Last item on the agenda, Toby would like to make an announcement.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, I just wanted to let you know that, uh, I'll be taking a leave of absence starting next week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, because you've been on the Lam? Because the 'boring police' have been after you, and they finally caught up with you?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, no, the opposite. I was actually selected to be a juror on a very high-profile case.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, the case of the horrible red-headed sad sack. And the verdict, it was Toby. And the sentence, death. Death to Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Death to Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, that's hurtful talk. We've talked about that. You know, I don't interrupt your announcements.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what you, you, you leave these huge pauses in your sentences. What do you expect me to do?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's the case, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, I really can't talk about it, but it's a very high profile case.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is it criminal?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Have we heard of it?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is it the middle school teacher who tried to turn her foreign exchange student into a sex slave?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Was it the post office guy who rubbed his penis all over the mail?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Guys, it's a really big deal. [rubs his neck]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He's rubbing his neck. He's rubbing his neck!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: He's rubbing his neck.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He's rubbing his neck.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, Scranton Strangler! [all react]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I can neither confirm nor deny this. Let's just say I'll be up to my neck in jury duty. [excited outbursts]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was the worst joke ever.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Corporate will be sending someone else to take my place for a while.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay goodbye, goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, Holly Flax, she comes from the Nashua branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, uh, she'll be starting next week. If you have any questions about the transition, just let me know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hold on, Holly's coming back here?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Guys, who's Holly?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a great question, Erin. How do you describe somebody who is at the same time an old friend, and was a lover, and was a complicated part of my past, and maybe, just maybe a part of my future?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: She's one sassy black lady.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly's coming back, everybody, and we have to have a party.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm not sure the temporary replacement of an H.R. rep really warrants a party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, we'll postpone this party until then. This is too important. Cancel this one. Dwight get rid of the tree.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cancel. We're canceling it. [Michael starts to throw away all of the food]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, don't throw those out!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we have to cancel the party.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We can save that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, we're gonna get fresh for Holly. Fresh and new.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I bought these.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: These cookies are fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not. They're not. Fresh and new. Please let go. Please let go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, Michael, wait we don't have, we don't have the budget for another party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well then everybody'll chip in, it'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I honestly think you're idealizing people here again, Michael. I don't think that's gonna happen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, I'll pay for it. I'll pay for the party. It doesn't matter. This is way too important. People, Holly's coming back, and this is the most important Christmas party of my life. So back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Man, I worked hard. I worked so hard for this! I was after corporate constantly. I emailed Joe. I wrote letters. And, know who I end up owing this to is the Scranton strangler. Thank you. Thank you, Scranton strangler. I love you! You just took one more person's breath away.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have always had good Christmas parties here, as you know, but they've never been cool. [imitating Sean Connery] The name is Bond... Santa Bond. I'll have an eggnog, shaken, not stirred. Classic Brosnan. Santa... wonderful tradition. Everybody loves Santa. Everybody can't get enough of the jolly old man. But that is a myth, because you know what, he is not necessarily a big fat guy with a beard. He's not necessarily an old guy. No one knows what the real Santa Claus... God! Ow! [camera pans down to Angela pinning Michael's pants]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Just stop moving your calves so much while you're talking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, this year's gonna be different. We're gonna have fun. It's not gonna be tacky. It's going to be, you know what, the food is going to be austere. It is not going to be tacky, deli platter food. It's not gonna have a big, fat, gross Santa Claus. It's gonna be cool, sleek Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Maybe I'll bring my boyfriend. I'll invite him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I mean, unless there's any chance there could be press at this party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You never know about the press.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I only ask because he's a senator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could he help us with some parking tickets?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't think that's appropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then he's not a senator.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, he is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We still doing the gifts today? [Pam nods] I mean, it is the Christmas party. Well, the classy Christmas party.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. But don't get too excited, 'cause I didn't have a lot of time this year.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Me neither. Whew.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've been working forever on Jim's present. He always gives me the best Christmas gifts. He'll take a memory or a private joke, and he'll create something totally unique. I love them. So this year I made him something. A comic book. It stars Jimmy Halpert, a mild-mannered paper Salesman who, while riding his bike through the forest, is bitten by a radioactive bear, becomes 'bear man'. Wreaks havoc on the office. It's really good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [A note is on Jim's computer that says, "It is time. Parking lot at noon." Jim nods and hands it to Dwight who burns it.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... [sighs] Oh, no, no, no, no! Fake tree. No, no!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, it has the little...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, no, no. Holly's coming from New Hampshire. Somebody from New Hampshire looks at that and thinks it's a burning cross. No, no. I want you to go and get a real tree. Take some money. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Bass Player
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm looking for Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, that's me. Come on it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [scats awkwardly] There's nothing classier than boring Jazz music. I am here to tell ya. And I made a bit of a judgment call. I hired one musician, because I thought, what's better, to hire an entire quartet for half an hour, or one bassist for the entire day?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, any volunteers to come with me to go buy a Christmas tree?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I would, but I don't want to get dirty. There might be girls at the party.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why do you always think that girls are gonna be at the party? No one invited girls. It's just us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I will help. Although my 'brid', my hybrid, my Prius hybrid, won't fit a tree. Which is ironic, considering how many trees it saves on a daily basis.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I do, however, have a hookup with a dude who has a pickup.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, do you mean Darryl? That's a great idea. I'll ask him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. He works here. We all know him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I should come along, just 'cause he's my, you know, he's my hookup.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on, now, Justine, look... Listen, look, I've been planning this, okay? You cannot do this, Justine.

Quote.Speaker: Justine
Quote.Text: [on the phone] I'm not doing it! She told me she wants to have Christmas here.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: She did?

Quote.Speaker: Justine
Quote.Text: Yes. She wants to be around family for Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't know... I thought I was enough family for my daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Pam knocks on Darryl's door] Don't come in, I'm busy. [Pam opens the door]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's cool, Darryl, I'm here too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, sorry, I really didn't want to come in. It's just that we have to go buy a new Christmas tree, and we're hoping we could borrow your truck.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on, it'll be fun. We could do doughnuts in the snow on the way back.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No. Thank you for your interest in my truck.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Sorry. We'll uh, we'll leave you alone.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey... [sighs] You know what, I could use a breath of fresh air. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When Holly gets here, I want you to be very helpful to her.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I've looked her up online... there's nothing about her. She's made no impression on the internet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She doesn't need an internet presence, you just know.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell are you doing here? You're supposed to be in the courthouse.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, we're on recess. I came for the party. Hey, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What does the strangler look like? Is he gorgeous? He looks gorgeous in the drawings.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That scowl.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I can't talk about it or I'll get removed from the jury.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And then he will come back here and replace Holly, so stop asking him questions.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I know people are only this excited to talk to me because of the trial. But, they talk to me for a while, and maybe people realize I have something to say. And then one day, we're just talking.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [standing outside, dials Dwight's cell phone]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [voicemail recording] You've reached the voice mail of Dwight Kurt Schrute. Please leave... [Jim hangs up and turns for the door. It is pad locked. Jim turns as Dwight springs from a nearby snowman and pelts him with snowballs.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ahhhhhhh!!!! Ahh! Ahh! Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop! Stop!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh... oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grunting, shouting]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have no feeling in my fingers or penis. But I think it was worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [dumps the remainder of the snow in his bag on Jim, then rests his foot on Jim and raises his arms in the air] Haahh!! [runs off]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, I was laying on the ground, defenseless, and uh, he just kept throwing 'em until he exhausted himself. And, uh, [cell phone chimes] then... [reading text message] "How 'bout icing it? lol. Dwight."

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Is there any way I can get a hand with these, please?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry, I can't help you. I'm waiting for my boss' pretty friend to arrive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There she is. Hey. Erin, would you help her, for God's sake?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, you're Holly! Of course. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [weak Clint Eastwood accent] Well, well, well, if it isn't Michael Scott. You old bastard.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [imitating her accent] Well, I never thought I'd see your face around these parts, you old bastard.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well I did show my face around these parts, you old bastard.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Curly] Why, you're some sorta wise guy, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [as Curly] I most certainly am.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Unnnnnnngh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Homer] D'oh!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [as Marge] Oh, Homey. [they both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay... Holly's back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. Hi. Oh... [they hug]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [in monster voice] Oh, huggy monster!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh no, not the huggy monster! I don't wanna die! I don't wanna die! I don't wanna die! [both sigh] Wow. Well, everybody, you remember Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Did you bring us anything from Nashua?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. I brought um, some maple candy. But I have to admit, I got a little hungry on the drive, and I ate some of them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's adorable.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Would you put those out?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: To throw out? Or put out, like, six pieces for everyone?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, it's so nice to be back. It looks beautiful in here. Super classy. It's like a party for limousine drivers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you came on the day of our Christmas party.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, it's fabulous. I love what you did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Isn't it wonderful? We love it here. Don't you love it? All right, let me show you to your desk. [in a stereotyped Mexican accent] I show you to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [in the same accent] Watch out for my guns they're both loaded. [makes gun noises]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What kind of guns do you have? Six-shooter?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aww...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It's a pea shoot...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is weird. I can't believe you're here. This feels like you never left. Doesn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah, kind of.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, and you have a Woody. Bah! [the both chuckle] Oh, I love toy...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: AJ gave me that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's understandable. Still raw. Woody your favorite character?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know who my favorite character in Toy Story is? Andy's mom.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because without Andy's mom, there's no plot. And without any plot, there is no movie.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: That is a really good point. AJ said he hadn't seen any of the Toy Story movies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're kidding me. Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No. I know. I was like, "What? Are you serious?"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What a douche bag!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Get a life!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get a... yeah! Good riddance.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: We sat down and we watched them all in one day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Now he's the biggest Toy Story fanatic ever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good for him.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Next day I found him in my bed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? That's creepy. How did AJ get in your house?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: We live together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you do?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: He had a little note pinned to him that said, "You've got a friend in me."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [fighting back tears] Yeah, Randy Newman's the best.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah. I love him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Me too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Christmas tree, Christmas tree. Won't you be my Christmas tree.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, how about this one?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ehh, seems a little full of itself, right? Kind of a pretty boy? What if we got a really beat up one, like on Charlie Brown. And we just loved it for what it is?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe. I mean...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [on the phone] I just, no, she be talking to your mom or something. This is my daughter too, Justine! You seem to think, [Justine hangs up] oh... pick a damn tree already.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, hey, Darryl, listen, it's none of my business, but if I couldn't have Cece for Christmas, I'd be really upset too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't have kids or anything, but if my grandmother ever dies, I'm going to kill myself.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Jada don't want to spend Christmas with me. She told her mom it wasn't as much fun. And how could she say that? You know, I took her to the toy store to buy her own presents.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well Darryl, no kid wants to buy their own Christmas presents.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Her mom wants me to take her to mass. I guess that's something to do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, you should have her mom do the boring Christmas stuff on her time. You should be associated with the fun parts of Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How do I do that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bring her to the party. Yeah, we'll have Santa, and we'll play games with her. It'll be a lot of fun.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You'll be Mr. Christmas by the end of the night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey guys, the tree's here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nobody hug me, I'm covered in tree sap, so...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why would someone hug you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey there, Jada. Nice to see you again. I'm Santa Claus. Welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a sophisticated take.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: He doesn't look like Santa Claus.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, he doesn't. [to Michael] I told her Santa would be here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, I was told that Holly would be here, single and ready to date. And we all got misled.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who told you that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nora Ephron, in every romantic comedy ever made.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So is it an open relationship?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, God, no.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, you're almost 40. Oh, do you not want kids?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I want kids. I really want kids. But AJ and I are practically engaged. We talk about spending our lives together.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So where's the ring?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kelly! Um, how are you adjusting to the move?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Nobody cares about that. Look, you have to make him commit, or kick his butt to the curb.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You guys, I don't think any of us are really qualified to be giving Holly personal advice about her love life.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, maybe Holly's not in any position to be shooing guys away.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't get it! I'm sorry. I just, I don't get it!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay, listen, I'm gonna tell him that if he doesn't propose by the end of this year, we're over.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, an ultimatum.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It doesn't really seem like you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That is a great idea. Ultimatums are key. Basically, nobody does anything for me anymore unless I threaten to kill myself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [turns in Pam's chair with a Pam wig on and laughs maniacally]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't. Stop, Dwight! [Dwight pelts Jim with snowballs] Dwight, stop! Dwight, stop!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Oh, no!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Yes, taste my wrath!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Huh? You like that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Seriously!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay. [Dwight throws another snowball and laughs maniacally]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I have a wig for every single person in the office. You never know when your gonna need to bear a passing resemblance to someone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just want it to stop.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, cool right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: There's no connection between the origin story and the quest.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We need to know who Jimmy Halpert was before he was bitten by the bear. Otherwise, it's the bear's quest.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I just sorta meant, like, cute, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, did you come here for help, or did you come here for me to tell you how great it is?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, help, if it's something simple, like add page numbers or laminate it or...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, it sounds like you know what you want. [Pam walks away] It's also a little derivative of a serias called 'Bear Man'. Did you look that up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, Jim. Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There's this female uh, uh, stenographer at the courthouse...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Who looks exactly like you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's increadible.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah. No, it's uncanny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what's crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't reconnect with you right now. Hold on one second. [he hurls a snowball at Dwight with a lacrosse stick, misses, and shatters a window, everyone gasps] Excuse me. [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess there are just some people who you stay together with when you transfer, and some people you don't. And that's just the way it is. And I can be mature about that. [clip of Michael throwing Holly's Woody in the trash and pouring coffee on it]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's so cold. Even with my coat on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Maybe your senator boyfriend has a blanket in his car... for screwing Americans.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yet another opportunity where a blanket would have come in handy.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You guys, this has to stop. Someone could have really gotten hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What if Meredith was taking her smoking break below that window? You know what would have happened? The shards of glass would have shaved her face right off. And, yes, it might have been funny. But it also would have been incredibly tragic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could not agree more. And just want to state for the record that I am intending to sue Jim for acute psychological distress.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about? You're the one terrorizing me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: With snowballs, Jim? With fluffy little snowballs? No. I thought we were just playing.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Dwight's right. What you did was dangerous and inappropriate. I'm really surprised at you guys. Last time I was here, you were both best friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All this arguing reminds me of a very funny story. You see this on my desk? [he holds up a toy taxi cab] Know who gave me this? My girlfriend Tara, who lives in New York City.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, what girlfriend?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I haven't told you about her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I find that unlikely. You email me when you get a new zit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm a man in my mid-40s and I still get zits. I think that's pretty interesting. But you know what? I am not on trial here. The Scranton strangler is. So, anyway, we have this great weekend, and she drives me to the airport, and we get to JFK, but I am flying out of LaGuardia. So we laugh and laugh and laugh, and then we spend the rest of the day walking around Slo-mo, drinking latte. And at the end of the day, she gives me this, and she says, "Michael, maybe next time, you should take a cab."

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I didn't know you had a girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do. She is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you see her face? Well it seems to me that there is a person sitting out there in the annex that still has feelings for Michael G. Scott. And it ain't Tara.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So you went homemade this year.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah. Money problems, is that what this is about? I mean, oh, dear, I don't think we can help you out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no. Jim had a great year, actually. I just wanted to get your opinion.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you good at homemade?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Look at this.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [walks in with a dirty Woody] Who did this? It's obvious to me I'm not welcome here, but somebody better tell me who did this, or else I'm leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, I don't think Erin seems to like you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's not true. I don't know her enough to make a decision even.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What happened? What happened? Toby, what did you do? I think Toby's very jealous of all the attention you've been getting.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, I would never ever do anything like that. But it does seem like something you would do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, really? Turn it on me. Well, isn't that nice? Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, guys, listen. Toy Story is all about toys that come to life when people aren't looking. You don't think... it's not possible... that Woody did this to himself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, it really seems like something Michael would do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm. Mmhmm. Well, the fact that you would think that points to the possibility that it is probably not me. And that I have been framed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why would anyone frame you for that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm sorry, why are we discounting this whole "Woody came to life" thing so quickly?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahhhhhh! [laughs] Surprise! It was part of the party. Pretty funny, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You think this is funny?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] I don't. But someday I think we will laugh about this... when we tell our kids...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yikes. [everyone gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh no, that's, that's not happening.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dear God in heaven.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Shh. Okay, you know what? Holly, I didn't mean to do it. It was an accident. An accident borne of jealous feelings.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, you have to let this go. I'm with someone else. I don't feel that way anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, really? You certainly seemed jealous when I told you about my fake girlfriend. That's what Jim and Dwight thought.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, hey, hey, hey...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, fake girlfriends are always wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You made up a fake girlfriend to see if I'd get jealous? And you destroyed a gift my boyfriend gave me? What is the matter with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When you got transferred, and I drove you up to Nashua, you said, "Michael, I love you, but I can't do this." But then, with this other guy, you don't have any problem with a long-distance relationship, do you? And you know what, that is what is the matter with me.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And we did this whole stupid party for you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [blocks Holly's path] No.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You guys, it wasn't my fault.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing is ever your fault! Just like when you ate those maple candies that you brought for us!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I really think you're better off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm. Erin, would you do me a favor and find my street clothes for me, please?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Is she an amazing cook or something?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [walks over to his desk and sees a present sitting on it, reading the note] "Hey, Pickles, Merry Christmas. Open immediately. Love, Swiss Cheese." [opens the present and a snowball shoots out at him, everyone laughs] Damn it, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Didn't think your affectionate nicknames would be your undoing, did you, Jim? Let that be a lesson to you all.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So do they bring in food, or do you get to go out?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, they bring it in.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You lucky son of a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I have been trying to get on jury duty every single year since I was 18 years old. To get to go sit in an air-conditioned room downtown, judging people while my lunch is paid for... that is the life.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Daddy, I'm bored. Can I read my book in your office?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Sure, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jada, Darryl, I'm so glad I found you guys. A grinch stole the star from on top of the Christmas tree and is hiding it in the warehouse somewhere. You want to go help me find him?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am the mean old grinch. The little girl who wishes to win back the Christmas star must first succeed at these challenges.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ohh, that sounds fun and Christmasy, you mean old grinch!

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: What kind of challenges.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wahhh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Something like an obstacle course, Mr. Grinch?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. You must answer topical political questions. How many congressmen is the state of Pennsylvania guaranteed? And what other state has the equal number?

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you know the other state?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Maybe the grinch hid the Christmas star, and we could ask for clues, and he'll tell us if we're hot or cold.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The star has been hidden. Is the little girl hot or cold? Well, it turns out she's burning up because the star is right behind her ear! [pulls star from coat and pretends to find it behind Jada's ear]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And the game's over seconds later.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm so glad you could come.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's nice. I know.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey everybody, this is my boyfriend, Senator Robert Lipton.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Senator, it's an honor. I'm Angela's friend Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oscar. A pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Robert seems great. He's very handsome, firm handshake, he's gay, good sense of humor.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: I'm, uh, I'm AJ. I'm here to see Holly. It's kind of a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know who you are, and I think you should go.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I bet you didn't even bring us anything, did you?

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Was I supposed to bring you guys something?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What? AJ!

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What are you doing here? Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: I wanted to see you. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Wow! Nice.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Oh, God, you look great.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh... when did you get here?

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Just now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Just now. Hey, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to see you again, AJ. Welcome.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Pleased to see you. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good trip down?

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, good. Good to see you. Have fun. Enjoy the partay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am dead inside.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What do you want, baby? We got some granola, got some cupcakes, chips, apples, pies...

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: You have a whole room of vending machines?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [chuckles] I know. Isn't it something?

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: I can't decide what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Darrly
Quote.Text: [handing out vending machine items to everyone] Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: And Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: And Merry Christ... mas.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas. And Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Bass Player
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Oscar unwraps a pair of Uggs] For your feet!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [holding a knitted iPad case] It's amazing. It's so great. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [Angela hands Creed a pack of deodorant] For me?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know if you guys have had a chance to use the new parking meters that accept credit cards, but Robert was instrumental in that legislation.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wow, that's awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: A real David and Goliath story.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'm just so touched that she's so interested in my work.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: The real problem is the teachers' union.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Zip it, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No. You tell me why my kid is 17 and still can't read.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, who's in charge of making drinks around here? Is there a bartender?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You are. You make your own drink. [Ryan groans]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll make it. What are you drinking.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: An 'F' train to Brooklyn. Extra bitters.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know how to make that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I'll just stick with my mojito.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And you know those annoying geese at the park? Well, he's helping eradicate them as well. I mean, I think they've really become a pest.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Annoying.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Jim hits a ceiling panel] I don't think he's in the ceiling, babe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, uh... I don't think any of us really know. Alright. [Jim hands Pam a present]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it... is it pebbles from that beach in Jamaica? [she shakes it]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, go easy with the shaking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [lifting up a diamond bracelet] Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You like it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup, I do make great Christmas gifts. But I couldn't make that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, my turn.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, um, it's just, I didn't, I didn't have a lot of time, so that's just a place holder.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right. Of course. [reading the comic book] "The Adventures of Jimmy Halpert." Oh, my God. This is awesome! That's my bike. That's my desk. And that is my daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean... [speechless]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, wait!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, hey, no, don't run. You're gonna slip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's good advice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup. I read this story about a woman who slipped on some black ice, and she hit her head and went into a coma forever. And then every day, her husband went and visited her in the hospital until she died.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a sad story.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [voice breaking] Yeah, well, at least he was married.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay, Michael, slow down. Everything's gonna be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not. It's not. Oh, man, I can tell you confidently that it is not gonna be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I shouldn't tell you this, but... AJ won't commit to Holly. And she's gonna tell him that if he doesn't propose to her by the end of the year, it's over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really. And I don't know about you, but I don't know of a lot of happy marriages that start off with an ultimatum, do you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So just be patient.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. I mean, I can wait till then. Come here. I don't want you to fall.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I surrender.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do not accept your surrender. There's only one way that I would ever relent.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Anything. You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You hit Pam in the face with a snowball while I watch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're a psychopath.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll take that as a no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was in the mall, and I saw that, and I thought it had your name written all over it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Michael, this is the gift that corporate gave us that I picked out. You're re-gifting this to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that's not... no, I went to the mall and I picked that out especially for you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah? Well, show me the receipt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hands Kelly a receipt from his wallet] From the mall. That...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This is a fast food receipt from April.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: God, how many number nines did you order?

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Is everyone here kind of mean?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I think everyone's on edge because of the strangler trial.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm so glad you came down. It's been so much harder than I expected.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Hey, what happened to Woody?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, okay, get ready for this. You're not gonna believe it. I was making salad, and he fell right into the dressing. I mean, there was salad dressing all over him.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: He smells awful.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It was blue cheese dressing.

Quote.Speaker: AJ
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We wanted to give you something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. A Hostess apple pie! This is my favorite breakfast. How did you know that? Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What do you say?

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you know, I seem to remember that Santa promised that he would listen to all the gifts you wanted for Christmas. Didn't he say that?

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I know where he is.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: A trampoline...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Video games.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Video games.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: A DSi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A DSi?

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: A horse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A horse.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: A pool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You, are you sure you don't want a pony? You want a real horse?

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. You have to pick up after them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, sorry. I'm ready.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't want to go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh... come on, bear man. Come on. [the lights flicker]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Have you ever seen 'em do that? [walk outside and the parking lot is covered with snowmen]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I had no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's, it's okay. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God. No, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. This is it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go! Go! Go!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? What is it? What? What is, oh, my God! [Jim starts attacking snowmen] Honey? Jim? Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In the end, the greatest snowball isn't a snowball at all. It's fear. Merry Christmas.
